Class Sports

java.lang.Object
Sports
Direct Known Subclasses:
Basketball, Football, Hockey, Soccer
public abstract class Sports
extends java.lang.Object
abstract class that serves as the base class for the sports hierarchy

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int currentPeriod
    private member of type int to hold the number of the current Period
    private boolean gameOver
    boolean, determines if the game is over
    private int[] score
    array of type int that holds the score of both players, index 0 for team 1 and index 1 for team 2
    private java.lang.String[] teams
    array of type string to hold the names of the two teams

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Sports​(java.lang.String team1, java.lang.String team2)
    Class super constructor, this cant be used to instantiate an object of the sports class but it can be called by the subclasses

      boolean, determines if the game is over

  • Constructor Details

    • Sports

      public Sports​(java.lang.String team1, java.lang.String team2)
      Class super constructor, this cant be used to instantiate an object of the sports class but it can be called by the subclasses
      Parameters:
      team1 - string holding the name of the first team
      team2 - string holding the name of the second team

  • Method Details

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      public method getter for the gameOver data member
      Returns:
      the boolean value of the gameOver variable

    • setGameOver

      public void setGameOver​(boolean gameOver)
      setter for the gameOver variable, call this method to indicate the end or start of the game
      Parameters:
      gameOver - boolean to set gameOver, this to indicate if the game has ended

    • setTeams

      public void setTeams​(java.lang.String team1, java.lang.String team2)
      setter for the names of the teasm
      Parameters:
      team1 - string holding the name of the first team
      team2 - string holding the name of the second team

    • getTeams

      public java.lang.String getTeams​(int teamNumber)
      getter method, this method takes in the team number either 1 for the first team or two for the second team and returns the name of the team
      Parameters:
      teamNumber - number of the team you want the name of
      Returns:
      string holding the name of the team

    • getScore

      public int[] getScore()
      getter for the score member
      Returns:
      the array holding the scores of both teams

    • getScoreBoard

      public java.lang.String getScoreBoard()
      method to be called to get the scoreBoard to be printed by the driver
      Returns:
      string holding the scoreboard to be printed by the driver

    • setScore

      public void setScore​(int teamNO, int points)
      method to set the score of the indicated team
      Parameters:
      teamNO - team number, first or second team whose score will be set
      points - score to be set to the assigned team

    • addScore

      public abstract void addScore​(int scoringMethodNo)
      abstract method to add score according to each subclass
      Parameters:
      scoringMethodNo - scoring method option

    • getScoringMethods

      public abstract java.lang.String getScoringMethods()
      abstract getScoring method for each subclass to implement
      Returns:
      a string

    • startTheGame

      public void startTheGame()
      method to start game by setting the current period to 1

    • endCurrentPeriod

      public void endCurrentPeriod()
      method to end the current period of game , this method calls the chackGameOver method to seee if

    • getLengthOfPeriod

      public abstract java.lang.String getLengthOfPeriod()
      abstract method to be overridden to get the length of the period
      Returns:
      as string

    • getCurrentPeriod

      public int getCurrentPeriod()
      get the game period object for the class
      Returns:
      int variable with the currentPeriod game number

    • setCurrenPeriod

      public void setCurrenPeriod​(int periodNo)
      setter to update the currentPeriod
      Parameters:
      periodNo - the period number to assign to the current period

    • getPeriodName

      public abstract java.lang.String getPeriodName()
      abstract method to get the name of the period
      Returns:
      string holding the period name this will change according to the type of the game

    • checkGameOver

      public abstract void checkGameOver()
      abstract method to be overridden by the subclasses

    • winningTeam

      public java.lang.String winningTeam()
      method to determine the winning team
      Returns:
      string variable holding the name of the winning team, or in case of a tie it returns the tie message
